name: Polynomial Data Type
body:
![screenshot](http://img526.imageshack.us/img526/1552/20120424020345.jpg)

This project showcases an implementation of a [polynomial](http://math.about.com/library/weekly/aa030502a.htm) data type in C++. It allows addition, subtraction, comparison, assignment, and other operations on polynomials. The full list of operations are listed in the screenshot above. For that to work, there was a heavy use of operator overloading. A polynomial like this "4x^2-3x^1+7" would be treated as an object (lets call it "p1") that we can use the above operations on with a different polynomial. For example, if we had another polynomial "p2" we could add (i.e. p1+p2), subtract (i.e. p1-p2), compare, (i.e. p1>p2), or assign (p1=p2) the two polynomials like we would do with integer variables. Download the code and try it out yourself.

You can find the full assignment [here](http://web.cecs.pdx.edu/~karlaf/CS202_Fall09/Prog3.html).
tagline: A polynomial data type in C++
